author: Ava Benny-Morrison, Bill Allison
description: One pardon recipient recalls president telling him, ‘You’re cleaner than a baby’s bottom.’
title: Lawyers Are Quoting $1 Million in Fees to Get Pardons to Trump

description: Army soldiers examine a building damaged by a suspected Indian missile attack near Muzaffarabad, the capital of Pakistan controlled Kashmir, on, May 7, 2025.
title: Pakistan Says It Has Shot Down Five Indian Planes, Taken Soldiers Prisoner

author: Andreina Itriago, Patricia Laya, Fabiola Zerpa
description: Five of Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado’s closest aides who were hiding inside the Argentine Embassy in Caracas have left the residence, according to people familiar with the situation. The people were not authorized to speak about the operation publicly.
title: Venezuela Machado’s Aides Leave Argentina Embassy in Caracas

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: The pharmaceutical industry estimates President Donald Trump’s new drug pricing proposal could cost drug companies as much as $1 trillion over a decade, its largest trade group is telling members of Congress.
title: Trump Drug Price Idea Could Cost Industry $1 Trillion, Lobbying Group Says

author: Allyson Versprille
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said Tuesday that his proposal to overhaul the US’s air traffic system, which he plans to unveil May 8, will cost “tens of billions” of dollars.
title: Duffy Says Air Traffic Overhaul to Cost Tens of Billions of Dollars

author: Saleha Mohsin, Catherine Lucey
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer will travel later this week to Switzerland for trade talks with China led by Vice Premier He Lifeng, jump-starting negotiations between the two nations.
title: Bessent, Greer to Meet China to Start Trade Talks This Week

author: Ryan Chua
description: China condemned the Central Intelligence Agency’s attempts to recruit its disenchanted citizens and warned of retaliation, days after the release of videos encouraging officials to spy for the US.
title: China Condemns CIA Videos That Try to Lure Disaffected Officials

author: Jordan Fabian
description: US President Donald Trump said it is not a good time to invite Russia to rejoin the Group of Seven major economies, months after saying he’d like to see the nation reinstated.
title: Trump Says It’s a Bad Time to Let Russia Back Into G-7

author: Alex Wickham, Joe Mayes
description: The UK and US are in intensive discussions about an economic agreement that would reduce the impact of some tariffs, with a team of British officials in Washington to negotiate terms this week, people familiar with the matter said.
title: UK and US in Intensive Talks on Economic Deal to Reduce Tariffs

author: Joe Mayes
description: Reform UK leader Nigel Farage and Britain’s main opposition Conservative Party attacked Prime Minister Keir Starmer over the country’s new trade deal with India, criticizing a provision that would see some Indian workers pay less tax in the UK.
title: Nigel Farage, Tories Attack ‘Two-Tier Kier’ on India Tax Terms

author: Josh Wingrove
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Josh Wingrove looks at the meeting between the leaders of the US and Canada. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Gives Carney a Fresh Start But No Concessions on Tariffs

author: Khalid Qayum, Ruchi Bhatia, Faseeh Mangi
description: India said it conducted military strikes against “terrorist camps” in Pakistan, an expected move after it pledged retaliations for an attack last month in Kashmir that killed 26 people.
title: India Hits ‘Terrorist Camps’ in Pakistan After Kashmir Attack

author: Erik Wasson
description: The chairman of the House tax committee warned lawmakers from high-tax states demanding relief from a $10,000 cap on the state and local deduction that they will have to settle for an “unhappy” compromise.
title: SALT Republicans Have to Accept ‘Unhappy’ Deal, GOP Chair Warns

author: Justin Sink
description: President Donald Trump said he was appointing Andrew Giuliani, the son of former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani, as the director of a presidential task force helping with preparations for the 2026 World Cup.
title: Trump Appoints Rudy Giuliani’s Son to Run World Cup Task Force

author: Michael Nienaber
description: Friedrich Merz sought to move past an embarrassing stumble as he took power in Germany, vowing to reboot the economy and revive the country’s military.
title: Merz Looks to Brush Off Stumbling Start and Take Germany Forward

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Senators Rick Scott and Elizabeth Warren are pushing for an independent watchdog at the Federal Reserve to “aggressively hold” senior Fed officials accountable.
title: Key Senators Push Legislation Giving Fed an Independent Watchdog

author: Ellen M Gilmer, Alicia A. Caldwell
description: The Trump administration wants to more than double the number of immigration jail beds as part of its ongoing push to carry out the largest deportation effort in US history, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem told lawmakers Tuesday.
title: Homeland Security Chief Seeks Extra Jail Beds to Aid Deportation Push

author: Ben Westcott
description: Australia’s main center-right opposition party is reeling from a landslide election defeat and grappling with an issue that has perplexed conservative movements across the world since 2016 — whether to embrace or distance itself from US President Donald Trump.
title: Australia’s Opposition Grapples With Trump Fallout After Defeat

author: Khalid Qayum
description: Pakistan’s defense chief warned of an “imminent” clash with India as a dispute over river water and blame for a terrorist attack last month in Kashmir escalates between the nuclear-armed neighbors.
title: Pakistan Says Clash With India ‘Imminent’ After River Flow Cuts

author: Bob Van Voris
description: A judge blocked the Trump administration from deporting alleged Venezuelan gang members held in New York, in the second legal blow to its removal plans in a week.
title: Trump Can’t Deport Alleged Gang Members Under Alien Enemies Act, NY Judge Rules

author: Laura Dhillon Kane, Brian Platt
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney had a clear strategy for telling President Donald Trump to his face that Canada won’t become the 51st US state: put it in the language of a land deal.
title: Canadian PM Carney Tries to Disarm Trump With Real Estate Talk

author: Maxwell Adler, Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said Tuesday the federal government would not finance California’s high-speed rail project, escalating tensions over the state’s long-delayed infrastructure plan.
title: Trump Says California’s High-Speed Train to Lose Federal Funding

author: Arne Delfs, Michael Nienaber, Kamil Kowalcze
description: The session of Germany’s Bundestag started in a festive mood with greetings for dignitaries there to witness a peaceful handover of power. A little over an hour later, havoc ensued that will leave a lasting mark on the start of Friedrich Merz’s term as chancellor.
title: Merz’s Chancellor Vote Fiasco Raises Doubts Over Germany’s Reset

author: Andrea Palasciano, Alex Wickham
description: The UK is pressing the European Union to more clearly back British participation in a €150 billion ($170 billion) defense fund after the first draft of a proposed security pact was largely silent on the demand, according to UK officials and documents seen by Bloomberg.
title: UK Seeks Firmer EU Support for Joining €150 Billion Defense Fund

author: Ryan Chua
description: The US Army and Navy failed to meet equipment and training standards in a joint operation to deliver aid to Gaza using a $230 million floating pier, which was plagued with issues and dismantled last summer, the Pentagon’s internal watchdog found.
title: Pentagon Watchdog Faults Equipment, Training in Gaza Pier Fiasco

author: Josh Wingrove, Laura Dhillon Kane
description: US President Donald Trump said he would prescribe tariff levels and trade concessions for partners looking to avoid higher duties, appearing to move away from the idea that he would engage in back-and-forth negotiations.
title: Trump Downplays Trade Negotations, Says He’ll Dictate Terms

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said the US would cease bombing the Houthi rebels in Yemen, after he said the group indicated to his administration that they would cease attacks on ships in the Red Sea.
title: Trump Says Houthis to End Ship Attacks, US to Cease Bombing

author: Anna Edney
description: The US Food and Drug Administration’s top inspection official asked colleagues to persevere in a resignation letter Monday, amid efforts by President Donald Trump’s administration to squeeze more work out of the agency as it cuts staff.
title: Top FDA Inspector Asks Staff to ‘Persevere’ in Resignation Note

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: The Irish government revised down its economic outlook as global trade uncertainty caused by US President Donald Trump’s tariff tirade threatens growth.
title: Ireland Revises Down Economic Outlook on Global Trade Risks

author: Mohammed Alamin, Simon Marks
description: Sudan’s military-backed government formally cut ties with the United Arab Emirates over what it described as “ongoing aggression” in the North African nation’s civil war.
title: Sudan Cuts Ties With UAE Over Ongoing Aggression Amid Civil War

author: Erik Wasson
description: House Republicans are considering establishing work requirements for able-bodied Medicaid recipients starting at age 18 and through age 64, New York Representative Nicole Malliotakis said Tuesday.
title: Republicans Weigh Medicaid Work Requirements for Adults Under 65

author: Gresa Kraja
description: An opposition party in Kosovo rejected Prime Minister Albin Kurti’s offer to form a coalition government and instead proposed that a transitional administration be formed to break the political deadlock.
title: Kosovo Opposition Party Rejects Premier’s Offer for Coalition

description: Friedrich Merz secured parliamentary backing as Germany’s new chancellor on the second attempt, paving the way for the conservative leader to take charge of Europe’s biggest economy but with considerably diminished authority.
title: Merz Secures Lawmaker Backing as German Chancellor in Second Try

description: The European Union gave its strongest signal yet that it’s serious about ending five decades of reliance on Russian energy, but a challenging geopolitical environment may derail its plans.
title: EU Plan to End Addiction to Russian Gas Faces Geopolitical Risks

description: India and the UK agreed a trade deal aimed at boosting economic ties between the world’s fifth and sixth-largest economies, as Washington’s disruptive tariff policies continue to reshape global trade.
title: UK, India Agree Trade Deal Amid Fallout of Trump Tariff Wars

description: Israeli jets struck the airport in Sanaa, Yemen’s capital, on Tuesday in retaliation for a Houthi missile strike last weekend, according to Yemeni media.
title: Israel Strikes Houthi-Controlled Airport in Yemen’s Capital

description: The European Union’s executive arm is set to propose a new package of sanctions targeting Moscow’s covert fleet of oil tankers as it seek to crank up pressure on Russia over its war against Ukraine.
title: EU to Propose More Sanctions on Russia’s ‘Shadow’ Oil Tankers

description: Columbia University will end funding to nearly 180 employees working on research impacted by the Trump administration’s cuts to federal funding for grants, university leadership said in a statement Tuesday.
title: Columbia Cuts 180 Staff Under ‘Intense’ Strain of US Cuts

description: Friedrich Merz on May 6. Photographer: Ebrahim Noroozi/AP Photo
title: German Lawmakers Gather For Second Vote on Merz as Chancellor

description: Friedrich Merz will make another attempt to secure parliamentary backing as Germany’s next chancellor later on Tuesday after his humiliating shock loss in an initial vote.
title: Merz to Make New Bid Tuesday to Secure German Lawmaker Backing

description: Marcelo Claure hasn’t set foot in Bolivia in more than a year but is betting he can fix the country’s politics.
title: Billionaire in Bolivia Wants to Wrest Presidency From Leftists

description: El hombre más rico de uno de los países más pobres de América Latina se ha propuesto salvar a su país.
title: El hombre más rico de Bolivia, Marcelo Claure, busca derrotar a la izquierda

description: President Xi Jinping will use his state visit to Moscow this week to showcase his tight ties with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin, and capitalize on a trade war that’s isolating Washington.
title: Xi Heads to Russia on Mission to Weaken US Power on World Stage

description: Iranian and US officials are set to meet in Oman this weekend for a fourth round of talks on Tehran’s nuclear program, Iranian media said.
title: Iran, US to Hold Next Nuclear Talks in Oman on May 11, Media Say

description: The “Donald Trump factor” may have got Mark Carney’s Liberals over the line in Canada and helped reelect Anthony Albanese in Australia, but there’s at least one place where the populist right is still on the rise: the UK.
title: Starmer’s Wooing of Trump Helps Farage Dodge Anti-Populist Wave

description: The European Union plans to hit about €100 billion ($113 billion) in US goods with additional tariffs in the event ongoing trade talks fail to yield a satisfactory result for the bloc, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Targets €100 Billion of US Goods With Tariffs If Talks Fail

description: Europe’s largest airlines are avoiding Pakistani airspace amid simmering tensions with India, adding another detour to global flight paths that have become increasingly caught up in military standoffs around the world.
title: Airlines Avoid Pakistani Airspace as Tensions With India Mount

description: I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston, and today we’re putting Fed-week analysis on pause for the moment to look at the debate on the global appeal of US assets. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.
title: Bessent Invokes Game-Theory Specialist in Hailing Dollar’s Role

description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to meet President Donald Trump inside the Oval Office in a high-pressure bid to reset a relationship that has been shaken up by tariffs and US threats to Canada’s sovereignty.
title: Trump, Carney to Meet With $900 Billion Relationship on the Line

description: This year, the best deals on Theragun massagers won’t come at Christmas.
title: Trump’s China Tariffs Are Already Threatening Christmas Shopping Deals

description: China’s President Xi Jinping has called on European Union leaders to stand with it against unilateralism, in a veiled rebuke to US President Donald Trump’s efforts to upend the global world order.
title: Xi Urges EU to Join Forces Against Unilateralism in Swipe at US

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Germany in Limbo as Merz Falls at First Hurdle

description: US Special Envoy Steve Witkoff is pushing for progress on a deal for Hamas to release the remaining hostages before the end of President Donald Trump’s tour of the Middle East, Israel’s Channel 12 reported, a move that would break more than two months of deadlock.
title: US Pushing for Progress on Gaza Ahead of Trump’s Regional Visit

description: Emmanuel Macron will host Syrian President Ahmed Al-Sharaa in Paris on Wednesday, in what will mark his first official trip to Europe since the toppling of Bashar al-Assad in December.
title: Syria’s Al-Sharaa to Meet Macron in Paris on First European Trip

description: University students in Serbia who have spearheaded months of street rallies against the government are now demanding early elections, posing a new challenge to the dominance of President Aleksandar Vucic.
title: Serb Protesters Now Want Snap Vote in New Challenge to President

description: The European Union expects President Donald Trump’s trade investigations to boost the amount of the bloc’s goods facing US tariffs to €549 billion ($622 billion), escalating the transatlantic conflict as the two sides are trying to negotiate a reduction in levies.
title: EU Sees Broader Trump Tariffs Hitting €549 Billion of Its Goods

description: Spain’s biggest ever blackout wiped almost €400 million ($454 million) off the economy, according to an estimate by the country’s largest domestic bank.
title: Spain’s Blackout Wiped €400 Million Off Economy, Top Bank Says

description: Three Singapore ministers dined with a China-born resident years before he was convicted in a record money laundering case in the city-state, according to photos of the gatherings and a local businessman who said he hosted them.
title: Singapore Ministers Defend Meals Taken With Money Launderer

description: Friedrich Merz suffered a shock setback when he fell short of a majority in an initial vote in the lower house of parliament to confirm him as Germany’s next chancellor, potentially delaying his swearing-in later on Tuesday.
title: Merz Loses Initial Vote to Be German Chancellor in Shock Setback

description: Singapore labor union chief Ng Chee Meng signaled he won’t seek a role in Prime Minister Lawrence Wong’s cabinet after a photo of him dining with man who was later convicted in a record money laundering case surfaced online.
title: Singapore Labor Chief Signals Won’t Seek Cabinet Role After Saga

description: Russia is considering changing its key budget-building mechanism in response to sliding oil revenue, in a sign the Kremlin expects crude prices will remain lower for longer while the war in Ukraine continues to drain state coffers.
title: Russia Mulls Tightening Budget Rule Over Slumping Oil Prices

description: Myanmar’s military, also known as the Tatmadaw, announced an extension of a ceasefire until the end of this month, though there have been multiple reports of continued air strikes and mortar attacks on rebel-held territories during the recent truce.
title: Myanmar Junta Extends Post-Quake Truce Amid Reports of Breaches

description: Explosions rocked the airport and port at Sudan’s main coastal city on Tuesday, the latest escalation in two years of conflict between the North African nation’s army and the Rapid Support Forces militia.
title: Sudan’s Crucial Port Rocked by Blasts as Civil War Intensifies

description: Friedrich Merz will take over as German Chancellor on Tuesday, replacing Olaf Scholz. After a confirmation vote in the lower house of parliament in Berlin, the conservative leader will be sworn in as the head of a coalition government of his center-right CDU/CSU bloc and the center-left party Social Democrats. Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook reports.
title: Merz to Start as German Chancellor, Replacing Scholz

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom called for federal tax credits of at least $7.5 billion and a partnership with the Donald Trump White House to help bring more filmmaking to the US.
title: Gavin Newsom Seeks $7.5 Billion Hollywood Aid, Trump Accord

description: Friedrich Merz has vowed to hit the ground running when he takes over as German chancellor on Tuesday, pledging swift action to galvanize Europe’s biggest economy, restore Berlin’s leadership role on the global stage and address voter concerns about irregular migration.
title: German Conservative Merz Wants a Fast Start as New Chancellor

description: New York asked a judge to stop the Trump administration from withholding federal approvals or funds in the president’s push to end Manhattan’s congestion pricing program.
title: NY Acts to Bar Trump DOT From Denying Funds in Congestion Case

description: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake swept to power last year with an unprecedented super-majority government. Now, he arguably faces an even more crucial election.
title: Sri Lanka’s President Seeks Reform Mandate From Local Elections
